alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 24 at 2:52AM PDT until March 24 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Areas of central Douglas County above 1500 feet, including the passes on I-5 between Glendale and Canyonville, Highway 42 near Camas Mountain, and portions of Highway 227 from Tiller southward. * WHEN...Until 2 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the commute this evening and Friday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
